benchmark_details.name: -LongBench
benchmark_details.overview: -LongBench introduces a length-controllable long-context benchmark and a novel metric, LongScore, to evaluate long-context capabilities of LLMs by disentangling baseline ability from long-context performance. It aims to provide a more accurate assessment of LLMs' true ability to handle extended contexts.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a robust platform for evaluating and comparing LLMs across varying context lengths, minimizing the influence of prior knowledge or base abilities.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The proposed metric requires models to demonstrate relatively strong base ability on the task, which can cause performance evaluation fluctuations if the base ability is insufficient.

data.source: Constructed from a combination of real and synthetic tasks to evaluate long-context capabilities.

methodology.calculation: LongScore separates Base Ability from long-context capability, allowing for a more accurate evaluation.
methodology.interpretation: Higher LongScore indicates better long-context capability regardless of base ability.
methodology.validation: Reliability and effectiveness of the benchmark validated through comprehensive experiments comparing various open-source models.
